com.twitter.heron.packing

Class CommonPackingTests

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.twitter.heron.packing.CommonPackingTests
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FirstFitDecreasingPackingTest, ResourceCompliantRRPackingTest

    public abstract class CommonPackingTests
extends java.lang.Object
    There is some common functionality in multiple packing plans. This class contains common tests.

      • doScalingTest

        protected PackingPlan doScalingTest(TopologyAPI.Topology testTopology,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> componentChanges,
                                    ByteAmount boltRam,
                                    int testBoltParallelism,
                                    ByteAmount spoutRam,
                                    int testSpoutParallelism,
                                    int numContainersBeforeRepack,
                                    int totalInstancesExpected)
        Performs a scaling test for a specific topology. It first computes an initial packing plan as a basis for scaling. Given specific component parallelism changes, a new packing plan is produced.
        Parameters:
        testTopology - Input topology
        componentChanges - parallelism changes for scale up/down
        boltRam - ram allocated to bolts
        testBoltParallelism - bolt parallelism
        spoutRam - ram allocated to spouts
        testSpoutParallelism - spout parallelism
        numContainersBeforeRepack - number of containers that the initial packing plan should use
        totalInstancesExpected - number of instances expected before scaling
        Returns:
        the new packing plan

      • testScaleDownOneComponentRemoveContainer

        public void testScaleDownOneComponentRemoveContainer()
                                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Test the scenario where scaling down removes instances from containers that are most imbalanced (i.e., tending towards homogeneity) first. If there is a tie (e.g. AABB, AB), chooses from the container with the fewest instances, to favor ultimately removing containers. If there is still a tie, favor removing from higher numbered containers
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
